Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.

Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of the LORD'S hand double for all her sins.<RF>comfortably: Heb. to the heart<Rf><RF>warfare: or, appointed time<Rf><CM>
The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the LORD, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain:<RF>straight: or, a straight place<Rf><RF>plain: or, a plain place<Rf>
And the glory of the LORD shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see <FI>it<Fi> together: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken <FI>it<Fi>.
The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh <FI>is<Fi> grass, and all the goodliness thereof <FI>is<Fi> as the flower of the field:
The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the LORD bloweth upon it: surely the people <FI>is<Fi> grass.
The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.<CM>

O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift <FI>it<Fi> up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!<RF>O Zion…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion<Rf><RF>O Jerusalem…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem<Rf>

Behold, the Lord GOD will come with strong <FI>hand<Fi>, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward <FI>is<Fi> with him, and his work before him.<RF>with strong…: or, against the strong<Rf><RF>his work: or, recompence for his work<Rf>

He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry <FI>them<Fi> in his bosom, <FI>and<Fi> shall gently lead those that are with young.<RF>that…: or, that give suck<Rf><CM>

Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?<RF>a measure: Heb. a tierce<Rf>
Who hath directed the Spirit of the LORD, or <FI>being<Fi> his counsellor hath taught him?<RF>his…: Heb. man of his counsel<Rf>

With whom took he counsel, and <FI>who<Fi> instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding?<RF>instructed…: Heb. made him understand<Rf><RF>understanding: Heb. understandings?<Rf>
Behold, the nations <FI>are<Fi> as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.
And Lebanon <FI>is<Fi> not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
All nations before him <FI>are<Fi> as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.<CM>
To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
The workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.

He that <FI>is<Fi> so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree <FI>that<Fi> will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, <FI>that<Fi> shall not be moved.<RF>is so…: Heb. is poor of oblation<Rf>
Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth?

<FI>It is<Fi> he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof <FI>are<Fi> as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:<RF>It is…: or, Him that<Rf>
That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.

Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.
To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.

Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these <FI>things<Fi>, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that <FI>he is<Fi> strong in power; not one faileth.<CM>
Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the LORD, and my judgment is passed over from my God?

Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, <FI>that<Fi> the everlasting God, the LORD, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? <FI>there is<Fi> no searching of his understanding.
He giveth power to the faint; and to <FI>them that have<Fi> no might he increaseth strength.
Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:

But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew <FI>their<Fi> strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; <FI>and<Fi> they shall walk, and not faint.<RF>renew: Heb. change<Rf><CM>
